member.name: T:ClearCanvas.ImageViewer.MixedMultiFrameDisplaySetFactory
member.summary: A that splits series with multiple single or multiframe images into separate s.
member.remarks:
This factory will only create s when the following is true.
The input series contains more than one multiframe image.
The input series contains at least one multiframe image and at least one single frame image.
For typical series, consisting only of single frame images, no s will be created. The s that are created are:
One per multiframe image.
One containing all the single frame images, if any.

member.name: T:ClearCanvas.ImageViewer.ViewerActionPermissionAttribute
member.summary: Associates authority tokens with a viewer-specific action.

remarks.para: All tokens specified will be ANDed with , which is a global token intended to limit access to all viewer-specific functionality.

This attribute sets the action permissibility via the method. If multiple authority tokens are supplied in an array to a single instance of the attribute, those tokens will be combined using AND. If multiple instances of this attribute are specified, the tokens associated with each instance are combined using OR logic. This allows for the possibility of constructing a permission specification based on a complex boolean combination of authority tokens.

member.name: M:ClearCanvas.ImageViewer.ViewerActionPermissionAttribute.#ctor(System.String,System.String)
member.summary: Constructor - the specified authority token will be associated with the specified action ID.

member.name: M:ClearCanvas.ImageViewer.ViewerActionPermissionAttribute.#ctor(System.String,System.String[])
member.summary: Constructor - all of the specified tokens will combined using AND and associated with the specified action ID.

member.name: T:ClearCanvas.ImageViewer.DrawableUndoableOperationCommand`1
member.summary: A specialization of especially for objects that implement .

remarks.para: Once an is in the , a mechanism is needed to cause visible objects, such as s, to draw when an operation is undone or redone. For those objects that implement undo/redo using the Memento pattern (and ), and are also , this class will automatically redraw the object after the has been undone or redone.
See for a detailed explanation.

member.name: M:ClearCanvas.ImageViewer.DrawableUndoableOperationCommand`1.Execute
member.summary: On the first call, the is applied and this object is populated with a s wrapped in a to first undo (or redo) the operation and then draw the object.
member.remarks: You should call and check that the is non-zero before adding to the . Otherwise, there will end up being 'no-op' commands in the .

member.summary: s each command, from the end to the beginning.

member.summary: Applies to and returns an that can undo and redo the operation.
member.returns: An if application of resulted in a change to the internal state of , otherwise null.

remarks.para: The default implementation takes the returned by the base method and wraps it in a .
Inheritors can override this method to do any additional processing and/or to modify the resulting command, if necessary.

member.name: T:ClearCanvas.ImageViewer.IDicomPresentationImage
member.summary: The interface for all DICOM-based Presentation Images.

member.name: P:ClearCanvas.ImageViewer.IDicomPresentationImage.DicomGraphics
member.summary: Gets direct access to the presentation image's collection of domain-level graphics. Consider using instead.

remarks.para: Use to add DICOM-defined graphics that you want to overlay the image at the domain-level. These graphics are rendered before any and before any .

This property gives direct access to all the domain-level graphics of a DICOM presentation image. However, most of the graphics concepts defined in the DICOM Standard are already supported by the which inserts itself into this domain-level collection. Consider using to get a reference to a usable DicomGraphicsPlane object instead, since that provides all the logical support for layer activation and shutters in addition to enumerating all domain-level graphics. This property may change, be deprecated, and even outright removed in a future framework release.

member.name: T:ClearCanvas.ImageViewer.IUndoableOperation`1
member.summary: An interface for an operation on an object that implements undo/redo using the Memento pattern.

remarks.para: The Memento design pattern allows client code to perform undo/redo operations on an object without understanding any of the internals of how the operation is undone. All that is needed is a 'memento' from before and after any modifications are made to the object in question. These mementos can then be used to construct a single to be entered into the and the changes to the object's state can then be 'undone' and 'redone', simply be passing the memento back to the object.

This interface is merely an abstraction that allows client code to apply the Memento pattern to an arbitrary object without any understanding of the operation being applied or the participating objects.

member.name: M:ClearCanvas.ImageViewer.IUndoableOperation`1.GetOriginator(`0)
member.summary: In the memento pattern, the 'originator' is the object whose state is being captured and restored via a memento.
member.remarks: In this interface definition, the originator is purposely not of type T because you may actually want to perform the operation on an object that is not itself memorable, but rather on some memorable property.

member.summary: Gets whether or not this operation applies to the given item.

member.summary: Applies the operation to the given item.

member.remarks: The (IVC) is an whose purpose is to display images and to allow users to interact with those images. It provides a number of core services, such as image loading, layout, selection, rendering, etc. An API and a number of extension points allow plugin developers to extend the functionality of the IVC.

member.summary: Loads a study using the specified parameters.
member.remarks:
After this method is executed, the image viewer's will be populated with the appropriate , and objects.
By default, the Framework provides an implementation of called LocalStoreStudyLoader which loads studies from the local database. If you have implemented your own and want to load a study using that implementation, just pass in the name provided by as the source.
member.param: A object containing information about the study to be loaded.
member.exception: The specified study is in use and cannot be opened at this time.

The specified study is offline and cannot be opened at this time.
The specified study could not be found.
One or more images could not be opened, or an unspecified error has occurred.

member.name: M:ClearCanvas.ImageViewer.ImageViewerComponent.LoadStudies(System.Collections.Generic.IList{ClearCanvas.ImageViewer.LoadStudyArgs})
member.summary: Loads multiple studies, consolidating any errors that have occurred into a single .
member.remarks: This method of loading studies allows studies to be partially loaded. When an error has occurred, the exception is simply added to a list and studies continue to be loaded. Once complete, if any errors have occurred, a is thrown. If only a single study was requested, the behaviour is identical to and the exception will be one of those described for that method, not a .
member.exception: (When only a single study is requested) The specified study is in use and cannot be opened at this time.
(When only a single study is requested) The specified study is nearline and cannot be opened at this time.
(When only a single study is requested) The specified study is offline and cannot be opened at this time.
(When only a single study is requested) The specified study could not be found.
(When only a single study is requested) One or more images could not be opened, or an unspecified error has occurred.
Thrown when one or more of the specified studies has completely or partially failed to load.
The specified could not be found.

member.remarks: There is often a need for an that will listen for changes in activation. For example, the shelf that appears when the image layout tool activated has UI elements which should be enabled/disabled depending on whether the active workspace contains an . member.name: T:ClearCanvas.ImageViewer.IDisplaySet
member.summary: Defines a container for objects.

remarks.para: Disposal of an and it's contained s is handled by the framework when the is part of the hierarchy. When an is disposed, all its contained objects are disposed automatically.

You may create copies of s and s (via the mechanism) without keeping track of the objects and disposing them, provided the following two conditions are met:
The 'source' (e.g. the one being copied) must be owned by an at the time the copy is created; the owner must at some point become (or already be) part of the hierarchy.
Any s that are copied directly must be added to an that at some point becomes (or is already) part of the hierarchy.

member.name: P:ClearCanvas.ImageViewer.IDisplaySet.Linked
member.summary: Gets or sets a value indicating whether this is linked.
member.value: true if linked; false otherwise.
member.remarks: Multiple display sets may be linked, allowing tools that can operate on multiple display sets to operate on all linked display sets simultaneously. Note that the concept of linkage is slightly different from selection: it is possible for an to be 1) selected but not linked 2) linked but not selected and 3) selected and linked.

member.name: P:ClearCanvas.ImageViewer.IImageBox.NormalizedRectangle
member.summary: Gets or sets this 's normalized rectangle.
member.remarks: Normalized coordinates specify the top-left corner, width and height of the as a fraction of the physical workspace. For example, if the is (left=0.25, top=0.0, width=0.5, height=0.5) and the physical workspace has dimensions of (width=1000, height=800), the rectangle would be (left=250, top=0, width=500, height=400)

member.summary: Loads a study using the specified parameters.
member.remarks:
After this method is executed, the image viewer's will be populated with the appropriate , and objects.
By default, the Framework provides an implementation of called LocalStoreStudyLoader which loads studies from the local database. If you have implemented your own and want to load a study using that implementation, just pass in the name provided by as the source.
member.param: A object containing information about the study to be loaded.
member.exception: The specified study is in use and cannot be opened at this time.
The specified study is nearline and cannot be opened at this time.
The specified study is offline and cannot be opened at this time.
The specified study could not be found.

member.name: T:ClearCanvas.ImageViewer.ImageOperationApplicator
member.summary: Encapsulates the application of an to a list of s and also creates an that can be entered into the .

remarks.para: This interface may be deprecated in a future release. Consider using the instead.

It is often desirable to apply an operation across all linked objects. For example, when an image is zoomed, it is expected that all linked images will zoom as well. When that operation is undone, it is expected that it is undone on all of those images. This class encapsulates that functionality so that the plugin developer doesn't have to deal with such details.

member.name: M:ClearCanvas.ImageViewer.ImageOperationApplicator.#ctor(ClearCanvas.ImageViewer.IPresentationImage,ClearCanvas.ImageViewer.IUndoableOperation{ClearCanvas.ImageViewer.IPresentationImage})
member.summary: Constructor.
member.param: The 'current' (or reference) .
The operation to be performed on the current and/or its linked images.

member.name: P:ClearCanvas.ImageViewer.ImageOperationApplicator.ApplyToAllImageSets
member.summary: Gets or sets whether the operation should be applied to all s.

remarks.para: When this value is true, the operation will be applied to all s with linked s. When false, the operation will only be applied to the current 's linked s (determined from the current ).
When the current is not linked, the operation is only applied to the current .
The default value is false.

member.name: M:ClearCanvas.ImageViewer.ImageOperationApplicator.ApplyToAllImages
member.summary: Applies the same to the current image as well as all its linked images.

remarks.para: will be called only for images where has returned true and has returned a non-null value.
Each affected image is drawn automatically by this method.

member.name: M:ClearCanvas.ImageViewer.ImageOperationApplicator.ApplyToReferenceImage
member.summary: Applies the to only the current (reference) image.

remarks.para: will be called only for the image if has returned true and has returned a non-null value.
The affect image is drawn automatically by this method.

member.name: M:ClearCanvas.ImageViewer.ImageOperationApplicator.ApplyToLinkedImages
member.summary: Applies the same to all linked images, but not the current (reference) image itself.

remarks.para: will be called only for images where has returned true and has returned a non-null value.
Each affected image is drawn automatically by this method.

member.name: T:ClearCanvas.ImageViewer.NearlineLoadStudyException
member.summary: Exception class for a study that could not be loaded because it is currently nearline.
member.remarks: A 'nearline' study is one that is not readily available, but can be automatically brought back online in a reasonable amount of time. In the case of a CC Streaming server, the fact that the study headers were requested is enough to trigger a restore of the study from an archive. Therefore, if you receive this exception, there is nothing that needs to be done to trigger the retrieval other than waiting a few minutes and trying again.

member.name: T:ClearCanvas.ImageViewer.PhysicalWorkspace
member.summary: A container for image boxes.

remarks.para: and its related classes and collectively describe how images are positioned and sized on the screen. A contains zero or more image boxes, which in turn each contain zero or more tiles. Image boxes can be arranged arbitrarily in a workspace whereas tiles in an image box must be laid out as a rectangular grid. A tile contains a .

Physical workspace layouts are described in normalized coordinates. The top left corner of the workspace corresponds to (0,0) and the bottom right (1,1). When an is defined and added to a workspace, it is done using that coordinate system. See for an example.

member.remarks: When a is first instantiated, is empty.

member.summary: Gets the number of rows of objects in the .
member.remarks: is only valid if has been called. Otherwise, the value is meaningless.

member.name: T:ClearCanvas.ImageViewer.UndoableOperationCommand`1
member.summary: An specifically for operations on objects that implement the Memento pattern using .

remarks.para: This class is used in conjunction with , which is intended to streamline application of the same operation to objects implementing the Memento pattern via . See the comments for for information on the pattern of applying the operation and creating the .

The removes all the burden of properly applying the and obtaining the mementos for any number of objects. Given the and a list of items to which the operation should be applied, the first call to will automatically apply the and populate itself with a for each object that actually changed as a result of the operation. Since the application of the operation is not guaranteed to result in any changes, you should check that the property is non-zero after first calling before adding the to the .

member.name: T:ClearCanvas.ImageViewer.Volumes.Volume
member.summary: Represents a 3-dimensional raster volume.
member.remarks: The class encapsulates 3-dimensional raster data (i.e. a volume defined by a block of voxels). Typically, an instance of is created from a set of DICOM images by calling or any of its overloads. Alternatively, the may be used to obtain a wrapper object that allows access to a shared, cached and memory-managed instance of .

member.name: T:ClearCanvas.ImageViewer.Volumes.Volume.VolumeReference
member.summary: Implements
member.remarks: Although the volume itself no longer holds any unmanaged resources, and thus we can rely on the finalizer to appropriately handle cleanup, we encourage client code to use references rather hold the volume directly, since then the code is theoretically capable of using the volume cache and memory management system, which uses references by necessity.

member.name: P:ClearCanvas.ImageViewer.Volumes.ICachedVolume.Identifier
member.summary: Gets a GUID uniquely identifying the cached MPR volume.
member.remarks: This identifier GUID will remain consistent for the same set of source frames, even if the volume is unloaded and reloaded by the .

member.name: P:ClearCanvas.ImageViewer.Volumes.ICachedVolume.Volume
member.summary: Gets the MPR volume, synchronously loading the volume if necessary.
member.remarks: Client code should not hold on to the instance returned by this property. If a long-term reference is desired, call and store the result from , accessing the property as necessary. This is important, because the may decide to unload the actual volume at any time, and a direct reference to a specific can point to a disposed object if held on to for any significant period of time.

member.name: M:ClearCanvas.ImageViewer.Volumes.ICachedVolume.CreateReference
member.summary: Creates a long-term reference to the cached MPR volume.
member.remarks: Calling code should ensure that the instance returned by this method is properly disposed. This will ensure that all resources held by the cache object, including the volume itself as well as the references to the source frames, can be properly released when no other cache references exist.

member.name: T:ClearCanvas.ImageViewer.Volumes.VolumeCache
member.summary: Implementation of a memory-managed MPR volume cache.
member.remarks: The items returned by this cache are container objects that hold the MPR volume, references to the source frames, as well as implement memory management. Direct references to this object (and the actual MPR Volume exposed by ) should not be held on to by client code for any significant period of time, as the underlying instance of may be disposed of at any time by the . Instead, if a long-term reference is desired, create a reference with . When all outstanding references to the have been disposed, the item will itself be removed from the cache, releasing the references to the source frames as well as the instance.

member.name: T:ClearCanvas.ImageViewer.Volumes.VolumeSliceFactory
member.summary: Factory class for creating instances representing 2-dimensional slices of a .

member.name: M:ClearCanvas.ImageViewer.Volumes.VolumeSliceFactory.#ctor
member.summary: Initializes a new instance of .

member.name: P:ClearCanvas.ImageViewer.Volumes.VolumeSliceFactory.RowOrientationPatient
member.summary: Gets or sets the row orientation of the output as a directional vector in patient coordinates.

remarks.para: If not specified, the original row orientation of the source volume will be used.
In DICOM, this parameter is equivalent to the row component of the Image Position (Patient).

member.name: P:ClearCanvas.ImageViewer.Volumes.VolumeSliceFactory.ColumnOrientationPatient
member.summary: Gets or sets the column orientation of the output as a directional vector in patient coordinates.

remarks.para: If not specified, the original column orientation of the source volume will be used.
In DICOM, this parameter is equivalent to the column component of the Image Position (Patient).

member.name: P:ClearCanvas.ImageViewer.Volumes.VolumeSliceFactory.StackOrientationPatient
member.summary: Gets or sets the stack orientation of the output slices as a directional vector in patient coordinates.

remarks.para: In general, the stack orientation does not need to be specified, and the direction orthogonal to both the slice plane will be used.
In DICOM, this parameter is equivalent to the vector formed by the difference of the Image Position (Patient) of two consecutive images.

member.name: P:ClearCanvas.ImageViewer.Volumes.VolumeSliceFactory.RowSpacing
member.summary: Gets or sets the spacing, in patient units, between consecutive rows of the output.

remarks.para: If not specified, a suitable isotropic spacing (i.e. will be the same as ) will be derived based on the source volume spacing.
In DICOM, this parameter is equivalent to the row component of the Pixel Spacing.

member.name: P:ClearCanvas.ImageViewer.Volumes.VolumeSliceFactory.ColumnSpacing
member.summary: Gets or sets the spacing, in patient units, between consecutive columns of the output.

remarks.para: If not specified, a suitable isotropic spacing (i.e. will be the same as ) will be derived based on the source volume spacing.
In DICOM, this parameter is equivalent to the column component of the Pixel Spacing.

member.name: P:ClearCanvas.ImageViewer.Volumes.VolumeSliceFactory.Rows
member.summary: Gets or sets the number of rows in the output.

remarks.para: If not specified, a suitable value will be derived from or, failing that, chosen such that the entire source volume will be visible in the output.

member.name: P:ClearCanvas.ImageViewer.Volumes.VolumeSliceFactory.Columns
member.summary: Gets or sets the number of columns in the output.

remarks.para: If not specified, a suitable value will be derived from or, failing that, chosen such that the entire source volume will be visible in the output.

member.name: P:ClearCanvas.ImageViewer.Volumes.VolumeSliceFactory.SliceWidth
member.summary: Gets or sets the width, in patient units, of each individual slice of the output.

remarks.para: If is specified, that value will take precendence. If not specified, a suitable value will be chosen such that the entire source volume will be visible in the output.

member.name: P:ClearCanvas.ImageViewer.Volumes.VolumeSliceFactory.SliceHeight
member.summary: Gets or sets the height, in patient units, of each individual slice of the output.

remarks.para: If is specified, that value will take precendence. If not specified, a suitable value will be chosen such that the entire source volume will be visible in the output.

member.name: P:ClearCanvas.ImageViewer.Volumes.VolumeSliceFactory.SliceSpacing
member.summary: Gets or sets the spacing, in patient units, between consecutive slices of the output.

member.name: P:ClearCanvas.ImageViewer.Volumes.VolumeSliceFactory.SliceThickness
member.summary: Gets or sets the thickness, in patient units, represented by each individual slice of the output.

member.name: P:ClearCanvas.ImageViewer.Volumes.VolumeSliceFactory.Interpolation
member.summary: Gets or sets the interpolation mode of the output.

remarks.para: The default value is .

member.name: P:ClearCanvas.ImageViewer.Volumes.VolumeSliceFactory.Projection
member.summary: Gets or sets the projection mode of the output.

remarks.para: The default value is .
